messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Kahlil Gibran
messages.msgSnippet: I have the album and I sing it ever day.  Lisa ... From: warblwarbl@aol.com [mailto:warblwarbl@aol.com] Sent: Wednesday, September 25, 2002 2:15 AM To:
messages.messageBody:
I have the album and I sing it ever day. Lisa

-----Original Message-----
From: warblwarbl@... [mailto:warblwarbl@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 25, 2002 2:15 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Kahlil Gibran

In a message dated 9/22/2002 10:50:40 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I love Kahlil Gibran. Did you read what he says on children. It
starts
> off with "Your children are not your children but they are the sons
and
> the daughters of life's longing for itself." It is a must read in the
> Prophet. Lisa
>
If you've never heard how Sweet Honey and the Rock set this to music,
you've
got to go out and find it. An unschooling anthem, I'd say.

Pam T.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
